snippet: A study of dust mites, which are free-living, suggest they evolved from parasites that in turn had evolved from free-living organisms, contradicting an axiom that species cannot regain lost characteristics.
abstract: Study in journal Systemic Biology suggests that dust mites, which are free-living, may have evolved from parasites that in turn had evolved from free-living organisms, contradicting axiom that species cannot regain lost characteristics.
lead_paragraph: A study of dust mites, which are free-living, suggest they evolved from parasites that in turn had evolved from free-living organisms, contradicting an axiom that species cannot regain lost characteristics.

headline.print_headline: Evolution: A Challenge to Dollo’s Law
headline.seo: A Challenge to Dollo’s Law of Irreversibility
